result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon L Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
During period of Prison Incarceration, 25% of the defendant's Prison Inmate Funds are to be applied toward restitution owed - per Prison policy
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with other sentences the defendant is serving
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing to ensure abstinence

No Contact with the victims in any of these cases
.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay restitution of $774.91 to J.B. (in LAX Case 15CF141), $1600 to G.K. (in Iowa Co case 15CF98), and $406.50 to Richie Implement (in Iowa Co case 15CF98).  Restitution owed in Vernon Co case 15CF33 to be held open for 30 days to determine amount

Pay 10% restitution surcharge (see 'other' above)

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
